Paragraph.Text: the words “For veterinary use only” and “Pour usage vétérinaire seulement” or other wording to the same effect; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: any cautionary information necessary to ensure the safe handling and use of the veterinary biologic.

Subsection.Text: Subsection 134(3) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subject to subsection (4), the information required by subsection (1), as well as any supplemental information appearing on the label, shall be shown in both official languages, and may additionally be shown in whole or in part in any other language.
A person may sell, advertise or offer for sale in Canada a veterinary biologic that is labelled in only one official language if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the veterinary biologic is needed for research or emergency use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person undertakes to ensure its safe storage, handling and administration.

Subsection.Text: The French version of the Regulations is amended by replacing “produit vétérinaire biologique” and “produits vétérinaires biologiques” with “produit biologique vétérinaire” and “produits biologiques vétérinaires”, respectively, in the following provisions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the definition date de péremption in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraphs (a), (b) and (c) of the definition données générales sur le produit in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the definition emballage in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the definition étiquette in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the definition nom assigné in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the definition permis de fabrication in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the definition produit vétérinaire biologique in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the definition publicité in section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 51(c);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the portion of subsection 51.2(1) before paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the heading before section 120;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the definition produit vétérinaire biologique in section 120;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the heading before section 120.1;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the definition dissémination in section 120.1;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the definition méthode de confinement in section 120.1;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the definition produit vétérinaire biologique vivant et génétiquement modifié in section 120.1;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 120.2(2)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: clause 120.2(2)(a)(ii)(A);

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: clause 120.2(2)(a)(ii)(B);

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 120.2(2)(b);

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: the portion of subsection 120.3(1) before paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (v)

Paragraph.Text: section 135.1

Subsection.Text: The expression “(produit vétérinaire biologique)” at the end of the definition veterinary biologic in section 2 of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the expression “(produit biologique vétérinaire)”.

The expression “(produit vétérinaire biologique)” at the end of the definition veterinary biologic in section 120 of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the expression “(produit biologique vétérinaire)”.

The expression “(produit vétérinaire biologique vivant et génétiquement modifié)” at the end of the definition live genetically modified veterinary biologic in section 120.1 of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the expression “(produit biologique vétérinaire vivant et génétiquement modifié)”.
The definition registered processed egg station in section 2 of the Health of Animals Regulations7 is repealed.
Paragraph (c) of the definition country of origin in section 2 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to an animal product or animal by-product — other than non-fertilized ova, semen and meat — that has undergone processing that would prevent the introduction of any reportable disease, any disease referred to in Schedule VII and any serious epizootic disease to which the species from which the product or by-product was derived is susceptible and that can be transmitted by the product or by-product, the country in which the product or by-product underwent that processing; (pays d’origine)

Subsection.Text: Section 2 of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: meat means the edible part of a carcass that is the muscle associated with the skeleton, tongue, diaphragm, heart, gizzard or mammalian oesophagus, with or without accompanying and overlying fat, together with those parts of the bones, skin, sinews, nerves, blood vessels and other tissues that normally accompany the muscle and are not ordinarily removed in dressing a carcass, but does not include the muscle associated with the lips, snout, scalp or ears; (viande)

Section.Text: Paragraph 5(3)(a) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: removed to and destroyed at an establishment where food animals are slaughtered by the holder of a licence that is issued under paragraph 20(1)(b) of the Safe Food for Canadians Act; or

Section.Text: Subsection 34(3) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (2)(a) does not apply to eggs imported into Canada if they are transported under seal of an inspector direct from the place of entry to a processed egg product establishment approved by the Minister.

In subsection (3), processed egg product establishment means an establishment where eggs or processed egg products are processed, treated or preserved by the holder of a licence that is issued under paragraph 20(1)(b) of the Safe Food for Canadians Act.

Section.Text: Subsection 175.1(2) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of an ovine that is transported directly for slaughter either to an establishment where food animals are slaughtered by the holder of a licence that is issued under paragraph 20(1)(b) of the Safe Food for Canadians Act or to an establishment that is registered under an Act of a province that provides for the inspection of ovine carcasses.
